message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SD, cs.CY 

This paper focuses on natural language processing techniques to generate a summary of a controversy on social media, specifically Twitter. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper involves ranking tweets based on their relevance to the two conflicting stances, which falls under the sub-category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). The paper also discusses the characteristics of a good stance summary, which could be relevant to the sub-category of Cybersecurity (cs.CY) and Software Engineering (cs.SD).
